6.4. Binary TypesÂ¶

ITTIA DB IoT can store binary data in the blob and varbinary types. Binary data is always stored in its original form, regardless of the byte order or encoding of the platform.

The blob type can store an unlimited number of bytes in a table field. The number of bytes used by a blob field is always a multiple of the page size configured for the storage. However, a blob field that is null consumes no database pages. Binary data can be loaded into a blob field from a stream or other sequential data source. Random access can be used to read data from any offset in a blob field.

The varbinary type can store a fixed number of bytes in a table field. The number of bytes used by a varbinary field is equal to the size of the data stored. The entire varbinary field is read or written at once.
